meanings.definition: Small finch-like birds with colorful plumage.
meanings.sent1: The waxbills chirped happily in the garden.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of waxbills flying together in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The waxbills decided to have a singing competition.
meanings.sent4: Her dress was as vibrant as a flock of waxbills.
meanings.sent5: The children were mesmerized by the beauty of the waxbills.

meanings.definition: To increase or grow in size or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The flowers seemed to waxbills overnight.
meanings.sent2: His excitement waxbills as the party approached.
meanings.sent3: The suspense in the room continued to waxbills.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter waxbills through the quiet night.
meanings.sent5: The cheers from the crowd waxbills with each goal scored.
